Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description:
You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to five creatures.

Forbidding Ward.name: Forbidding Ward
Forbidding Ward.description:
You ward an ally against the attacks and hostile spells from the target enemy. The target ally gains a +1 status bonus to Armor Class and saving throws against the target enemy's attacks, spells, and other effects.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.ctMxYPGEpstvhW9C]{Spell Effect: Forbidding Ward}

Heightened (6th) The status bonus increases to +2.

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A ray that saps a foe's strength flashes from your hand. Attempt a ranged spell attack against the target. If you succeed, that creature attempts a Fortitude save to determine the spell's effect. If your attack roll is a critical success, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of its save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}.

Critical Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}.

Familiar.name: 魔宠 Familiar
Familiar.description: 苏塔奴的魔宠是名为勇锁（Yon-so）的象鹰。勇锁拥有40尺飞行速度，黑暗视觉，30尺灵敏嗅觉（模糊）。

Choking Hair.name: 窒息活发 Choking Hair
Choking Hair.description: 只要苏塔奴用她的头发持续擒抱一个生物，该生物就无法呼吸，并且在尝试任何需要说话的动作时（这包括语言效果和施展包含言语要素的法术），必须尝试@Check[flat|dc:5]检定。如果失败，该动作被打断。

Empowered Hair.name: 强化活发 Empowered Hair
Empowered Hair.description: 苏塔奴在使用活发上的造诣独树一帜。她的活发可以用来执行精确动作，比如开锁甚至简单的交互动作，并且她能用活发自动进行擒获，如同名怪物能力。她可通过活发传递巫术。当苏塔奴成功施放需要2个或更多动作且无需攻击骰的巫术聚能法术时，若目标在触及内，作为施法动作的一部分，在应用巫术效果前，她可选择对该目标进行一次活发打击。若打击未命中，巫术不生效。

Mask of Terror.description:
The target appears to be a gruesome and terrifying creature. The effect is unique to each observer, so a human viewing the target might see a demon with bloody fangs, but a demon observing the target might see a glowing angelic visage. When any creature attempts a hostile action against the target, the creature must attempt a Will save. It is then temporarily immune until the end of its next turn.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} before using its action.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}, and its action fails and is wasted.

Heightened (8th) You can target up to 5 creatures. If a creature uses a hostile action or reaction that affects multiple targets simultaneously, it needs to attempt only one save against mask of terror.
Mask of Terror.name: Mask of Terror

Warp Mind.description:
You scramble a creature's mental faculties and sensory input. The target must attempt a Will saving throw. Regardless of the result of that save, the target is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes. Warp mind's effects happen instantly, so dispel magic and other effects that counteract spells can't counteract them. However, alter reality, miracle, primal phenomenon, restoration, or wish can still counteract the effects.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target spends the first action on its next turn with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} condition.

Failure The target is Confused for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is Confused permanently.
Warp Mind.name: Warp Mind

Dominate.description:
You take command of the target, forcing it to obey your orders. If you issue an obviously self-destructive order, the target doesn't act until you issue a new order. The effect depends on its Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} as it fights off your commands.

Failure You control the target. It gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled} condition, but it can attempt a Will save at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the spell ends.

Critical Failure As a failure, but the target receives a new save only if you give it a new order that is against its nature, such as killing its allies.

Heightened (10th) The duration is unlimited.
Dominate.name: Dominate

Antimagic Field.description:
You repel all magic from the target area, preventing spells and other magic from functioning. Spells can't penetrate the area, magic items cease to function within it, and no one inside can cast spells or use magic abilities, including yourself. Likewise, spells - such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} - can't affect the field itself unless they are of a higher level. Magic effects resume the moment they pass outside the field. For example, a ray fired from one side of the field could target a creature on the other side (as long as caster and target are both outside the field). A summoned creature winks out of existence but reappears if the field moves or ends. Invested magic items cease to function, but they remain invested and resume functioning when they exit the field; the ability boost from an apex item isn't suppressed within the field. Spells of a higher level than the antimagic field overcome its effects, and can even be cast by a creature within the field.

The field disrupts only magic, so a +3 longsword still functions as a longsword. Magically created creatures (such as golems) function normally within an antimagic field.
Antimagic Field.name: Antimagic Field

Mind Blank.description:
Powerful wards hide a creature from divination magic. The target gains a +4 status bonus to saves against mental effects. Mind blank attempts to counteract any detection, revelation, and scrying effects as if its spell rank were 1 higher than its actual level. On a success, the divination effect functions normally except that it detects nothing about the target and its possessions. For instance, detect magic would still detect other magic in the area, but not any magic on the target.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.DBaMtFHRPEg1JeLs]{Spell Effect: Mind Blank}
Mind Blank.name: Mind Blank

Duplicate Foe.description:
You try to create a temporary duplicate of an enemy to fight on your behalf. The target can attempt a Fortitude save to disrupt the spell. The duplicate appears in an unoccupied space adjacent to the target and has the target's attack modifier, AC, saving throw modifiers, Perception, and skill modifiers, but it has only 70 Hit Points and lacks the target's special abilities, including immunities, resistances, and weaknesses. It has no magic items except weapon potency runes. The duplicate gains the minion trait, and it can only Stride and Strike. Its Strikes deal the target's normal damage but don't apply added effects, since it doesn't have special abilities. The spell automatically ends if the duplicate's Hit Points drop to 0. The duplicate attacks your enemies to the best of its abilities. You can also try to give it additional instructions; when you Sustain the Spell, you can also Command a Minion as part of your action, but the GM determines whether the duplicate follows your command. The duplicate is unstable, so each turn after it takes its actions, it loses 4d6 Hit Points. It's not a living creature, and it can never regain its lost Hit Points in any way.

Critical Success You fail to create a duplicate.

Success The duplicate deals half damage with its Strikes and the duration is reduced to a maximum of 2 rounds.

Failure The duplicate works as described.

Heightened (+1) The level of creature you can target increases by 2. The duplicate has 10 more HP.
Duplicate Foe.name: Duplicate Foe

Feeblemind.name: Feeblemind
Feeblemind.description:
You drastically reduce the target's mental faculties. The target must attempt a Will save. The effects of this curse can be removed only through remove curse or another effect that targets curses.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} with an unlimited duration.

Critical Failure The target's intellect is permanently reduced below that of an animal, and it treats its Charisma, Intelligence, and Wisdom modifiers as -5. It loses all class abilities that require mental faculties, including all spellcasting. If the target is a PC, they become an NPC under the GM's control.

Repulsion.name: Repulsion
Repulsion.description:
You manifest an aura that prevents creatures from approaching you. When casting the spell, you can make the area any radius you choose, up to 40 feet. A creature must attempt a Will save if it's within the area when you cast the spell or as soon as it enters the area while the spell is in effect. Once a creature has attempted the save, it uses the same result for that casting of repulsion. Any restrictions on a creature's movement apply only if it voluntarily moves toward you. For example, if you move closer to a creature, it doesn't then need to move away.

Critical Success The creature's movement is not restricted.

Success The creature treats each square in the area as difficult terrain when moving closer to you.

Failure The creature can't move closer to you within the area.

True Seeing.name: True Seeing
True Seeing.description: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description:
You dilate the flow of time around the target, slowing its actions.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 minute.

Heightened (6th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

Mirror Image.name: Mirror Image
Mirror Image.description:
Three illusory images of you swirl about your space, potentially causing those who attack you to hit one of the images instead of you. Any attack that would hit you has a random chance of hitting one of your images instead of you. If all three images remain, there is a 1 in 4 chance of hitting you (1 on [[/r 1d4]]). With two images remaining, there is a 1 in 3 chance of hitting you (1-2 on [[/r 1d6]]). With only one image, the chances are 1 in 2 (1-3 on [[/r 1d6]]).

Once an image is hit, it is destroyed. If an attack roll fails to hit your AC but doesn't critically fail, it destroys an image but has no additional effect (even if the attack would normally have an effect on a failure). If an attack roll is a critical success and would hit one of the images, one of the images is destroyed and the attack roll becomes a success against you. Once all the images are destroyed, the spell ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.0PO5mFRhh9HxGAtv]{Spell Effect: Mirror Image}

Paranoia.name: Paranoia
Paranoia.description:
You cause the target to see all other creatures as dire threats. The target is stricken by intense paranoia toward all creatures around it and must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target believes everyone it sees is a potential threat. It becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.I1ffBVISxLr2gC4u]{Unfriendly} to all creatures to which it wasn't already hostile, even those that were previously allies. It treats no one as an ally. The spell ends after 1 round.

Failure As success, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, except the target believes that everyone it sees is a mortal enemy. It uses its reactions and free actions against everyone, regardless of whether they were previously its allies, as determined by the GM. It otherwise acts as rationally as it normally does and likely prefers to attack creatures that are actively attacking or hindering it over those leaving it alone.

Heightened (6th) You can target up to 5 creatures.

Cackle.name: Cackle
Cackle.description: With a quick burst of laughter, you prolong a magical effect you created. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3f5DMFu8fPiqHpRg]{Sustain a Spell} as a free action.

Forbidding Ward.name: Forbidding Ward
Forbidding Ward.description:
You ward an ally against the attacks and hostile spells from the target enemy. The target ally gains a +1 status bonus to Armor Class and saving throws against the target enemy's attacks, spells, and other effects.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.ctMxYPGEpstvhW9C]{Spell Effect: Forbidding Ward}

Heightened (6th) The status bonus increases to +2.

Guidance.name: Guidance
Guidance.description:
You ask for divine guidance, granting the target a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check the target attempts before the duration ends. The target chooses which roll to use the bonus on before rolling. If the target uses the bonus, the spell ends. Either way, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3qHKBDF7lrHw8jFK]{Spell Effect: Guidance}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3LyOkV25p7wA181H]{Effect: Guidance Immunity}

Needle of Vengeance.name: Needle of Vengeance
Needle of Vengeance.description:
A long, jagged needle jabs into the target foe's psyche whenever it tries to attack a specifically forbidden creature. Name yourself or one of your allies. The target takes @Damage[2[mental]] damage any time it uses a hostile action against the named creature.

Heightened (+1) Increase the damage by @Damage[2[mental]]{2 mental}.

True Strike.name: True Strike
True Strike.description:
A glimpse into the future ensures your next blow strikes true. The next time you make an attack roll before the end of your turn, roll the attack twice and use the better result. The attack ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the target being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.fpGDAz2v5PG0zUSl]{Spell Effect: Sure Strike}

Black Tentacles.name: Black Tentacles
Black Tentacles.description:
Area 20-foot burst adjacent to a flat surface

Oily black tentacles rise up and attempt to capture creatures in the area. Make spell attack rolls against the Fortitude DC of each creature in the area. Any creature you succeed against is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} and takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage. Whenever a creature ends its turn in the area, the tentacles attempt to grab that creature if they haven't already, and they deal @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage to any creature already Grabbed.

The tentacles' Escape DC is equal to your spell DC. A creature can attack a tentacle in an attempt to release its grip. Its AC is equal to your spell DC, and it is destroyed if it takes 12 or more damage. Even if destroyed, additional tentacles continue to grow in the area until the duration ends. You can Dismiss the spell.

Curse of Death.name: Curse of Death
Curse of Death.description:
You focus your malevolent gaze on a target, causing their heart to seize in dread. The target must attempt a Fortitude saving throw. Regardless of the result, the target is temporarily immune to further castings of curse of death for 1 day.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is afflicted with the curse of death at stage 1, and the stage of the curse can't increase beyond stage 1.

Failure The target is afflicted with the curse of death at stage 1.

Critical Failure The target is afflicted with the curse of death at stage 2

Curse of Death (curse) This curse ends immediately when the spell ends

Stage 1 @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[8d6[void]] damage and fatigued (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[12d6[void]] damage and fatigued (1 round)

Stage 4 death

Heightened (+1) Increase the void damage taken on a success and during the first three stages of the curse by @Damage[1d6[void]].

Synesthesia.name: Synesthesia
Synesthesia.description:
The target's senses are suddenly rewired in unexpected ways, causing them to process noises as bursts of color, smells as sounds, and so on. This has three effects, and the target must attempt a Will save. Due to the distraction, the target must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] each time it uses a concentrate action, or the action fails and is wasted. The target's difficulty processing visual input makes all creatures and objects @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from it. The creature has trouble moving, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} and giving it a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is affected for 1 round.

Failure The target is affected for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} as it attempts to process the sensory shifts.

Heightened (9th) You can target up to five creatures.

Blink.name: Blink
Blink.description:
You blink quickly between the Material Plane and the Ethereal Plane. You gain resistance 5 to all damage (except force). You can Sustain the Spell to vanish and reappear 10 feet away in a random direction determined by the GM; the movement doesn't trigger reactions. At the end of your turn, you vanish and reappear as above.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.ZlsuhS9J0S3PuvCO]{Spell Effect: Blink}

Heightened (+2) The resistance increases by 3.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description:
You befuddle your target with strange impulses, causing it to act randomly. The effects are determined by the target's Will save. You can Dismiss the spell.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target babbles incoherently and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the confusion.

Critical Failure The target is Confused for 1 minute, with no save to end early.

Heightened (8th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

Chilling Darkness.name: Chilling Darkness
Chilling Darkness.description:
You shoot an utterly cold ray of darkness tinged with unholy energy. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. You deal 5d6 cold damage, plus 5d6 spirit damage if the target is a celestial.

If the ray passes through an area of magical light or targets a creature affected by magical light, chilling darkness attempts to counteract the light. If you need to determine whether the ray passes through an area of light, draw a line between yourself and the spell's target.

Critical Success The target takes double damage.

Success The target takes full damage.

Heightened (+1) The cold damage increases by 2d6, and the spirit damage against celestials increases by 2d6.

Haste.name: Haste
Haste.description:
Magic empowers the target to act faster. It gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition and can use the extra action each round only for Strike and Stride actions.

Heightened (7th) You can target up to 6 creatures.

Malicious Shadow.name: Malicious Shadow
Malicious Shadow.description:
You reshape the target's shadow into a deadly form, such as strangling hands, a dangerous weapon, harrying runes, or the like, and command it to attack the target. When you Cast the Spell, and each time you Sustain the Spell, the shadow makes a Strike against the target. The shadow moves along with the foe, always remaining within reach. If you Sustain the Spell multiple times in a round, you gain this effect each time. The shadow uses and contributes to your multiple attack penalty.

The shadow's Strikes are melee spell attacks. Regardless of its shape, the shadow's Strikes deal damage equal to 1d10 plus your spellcasting ability modifier. You choose the type of damage when you Cast the Spell, choosing from bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. The shadow doesn't take up space, grant flanking, or have any other attributes a creature would. The shadow can't make any attacks other than its Strike.

The shadow vanishes if the target moves into an area of complete darkness or enters an area with light from all directions such that the target doesn't cast a shadow. If another effect is controlling the target's shadow when you cast malicious shadow, you can attempt to counteract that effect to temporarily take control of the shadow, but the original effect resumes when malicious shadow ends.

Heightened (+2) The Strike damage increases by 1d10.

Paralyze.name: Paralyze
Paralyze.description:
You block the target's motor impulses before they can leave its mind, threatening to freeze the target in place. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is Paralyzed for 4 rounds. At the end of each of its turns, it can attempt a new Will save to reduce the remaining duration by 1 round, or end it entirely on a critical success.

Heightened (7th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

Silence.name: Silence
Silence.description:
The target makes no sound, preventing creatures from noticing it using hearing or other senses alone. The target can't use sonic attacks, nor can it use actions with the auditory trait. This prevents it from casting spells that include verbal components.

Heightened (4th) The spell effect emanates from the touched creature, silencing all sound in or passing through a 10- foot radius and preventing any auditory and sonic effects in the affected area. While within the radius, creatures are subject to the same effects as the target. Depending upon the position of the effect, a creature might notice the lack of sound reaching it (blocking off the noise coming from a party, for example).

Daze.name: Daze
Daze.description:
You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

Evil Eye.name: Evil Eye
Evil Eye.description:
You fix your eye on the target, imposing a malevolent hex. The target becomes frightened based on the results of its Will save. This condition value can't be reduced below 1 while the spell is active and you can see the target. Regardless of the outcome, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description:
You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to five creatures.

Phantom Pain.name: Phantom Pain
Phantom Pain.description:
Illusory pain wracks the target, dealing 2d4 mental damage and 1d4 persistent mental damage. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes full initial damage but no persistent damage, and the spell ends immediately.

Failure The target takes full initial and persistent damage, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. If the target recovers from being Sickened, the persistent damage ends and the spell ends.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d4 and the persistent damage by 1d4.

@Damage[(@item.level)d4[persistent,mental]]{Scaling Persistent Mental Damage}

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A ray that saps a foe's strength flashes from your hand. Attempt a ranged spell attack against the target. If you succeed, that creature attempts a Fortitude save to determine the spell's effect. If your attack roll is a critical success, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of its save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}.

Critical Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

Telekinetic Projectile.name: Telekinetic Projectile
Telekinetic Projectile.description:
You hurl a loose, unattended object that is within range and that has 1 Bulk or less at the target. Make a spell attack roll against the target. If you hit, you deal bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage-as appropriate for the object you hurled-equal to 1d6 plus your spellcasting ability modifier. No specific traits or magic properties of the hurled item affect the attack or the damage.

Critical Success You deal double damage.

Success You deal full damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

equipment-+3 Greater Striking Jian.name: +3 Greater Striking Jian
equipment-+3 Greater Striking Jian.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

Taiga Yai.name: 寒林巨鬼 Taiga Yai
Taiga Yai.allSaves: 对抗魔法所有豁免+1状态加值
Taiga Yai.publicNotes: 披着寒林巨人的外貌。寒林巨鬼通常孤身一人四处游荡，永远渴望着新的体验与目的地。他们热衷于自己对大自然最纯粹的爱，并在继续前进之前愉快地摧毁他们遇到的任何业已建立的文明。

Botanic Interruption.name: 植物干扰 Botanic Interruption
Botanic Interruption.description:
触发 寒林巨鬼正站在一片天然植物或灌木丛中，并被近战攻击选为目标

效果 寒林巨鬼将他们的能量注入周围的植物中，使植物迅速生长并形成一个保护屏障。在对抗触发攻击的攻击骰时，寒林巨鬼的AC获得+2环境加值。如果攻击未命中，攻击者必须进行@Check[reflex|dc:33]豁免。豁免失败则因被植物缠住而@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{禁足 Immobilized}1轮；大失败的话，攻击者还会被击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
寒林巨鬼变为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.W1OXnXGF22uybovO]{寒林巨人 Taiga Giant}的外形。这不会改变其速度，打击攻击和伤害。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Return to Nature.name: 回归自然 Return to Nature
Return to Nature.description: 寒林巨鬼号令地底的植物根系将一个生物向地下拖入60尺。目标必须成功通过@Check[fortitude|dc:35]豁免，否则将@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{禁足 Immobilized}[[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}。在这之后此生物被埋于土中；其处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed}状态并开始窒息，只要还埋在地下，每轮就会受到@Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]]伤害。无论是想逃离禁足还是擒抱状态，该生物都必须通过DC 35@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{逃脱 Escape}检定，邻接他的盟友也能够通过一次成功的@Check[athletics|dc:33]检定来将其拉出。

+1 status to all saves vs. magic.name: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Earthquake.description:
You shake the ground, topple creatures into fissures, and collapse structures. The GM might add additional effects in certain areas. Cliffs might collapse, causing creatures to fall, or a lake might drain as fissures open up below its surface, leaving a morass of quicksand.

  • Shaking Ground The ground is difficult terrain, and creatures on it take a -2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, AC, and skill checks.
  • Fissures Each creature on the ground must attempt a Reflex save at the start of its turn to keep its footing and avoid falling into 40-foot-deep fissures that open beneath it. The fissures are permanent, and their sides require successful @Check[athletics|dc:15|traits:action:climb] to Climb.
  • Collapse Structures and ceilings might collapse. The GM rolls a flat check for each (@Check[flat|dc:16] for a sturdy structure, @Check[flat|dc:14] for an average structure and most natural formations, @Check[flat|dc:9] for a shoddy structure, all adjusted higher or lower as the GM sees fit). A collapse deals 11d6 bludgeoning damage; each creature caught in a collapse must attempt a Reflex save to avoid it.

Critical Success The creature takes half the collapse damage.

Success The creature takes half the collapse damage and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Failure The creature takes the full collapse damage and falls Prone.

Critical Failure The creature takes the full collapse damage and falls into a fissure.

Heightened (10th) You create a massive earthquake that can devastate a settlement. The range increases to half a mile and the area to a quarter-mile burst.
Earthquake.name: Earthquake

Tangling Creepers.description: Dense, twitching creepers sprout from every surface and fill any bodies of water in the area. Any creature moving on the land, or Climbing or Swimming within the creepers, takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds while in the area. Once per round, you can make a vine lash out from any square within the expanse of creepers by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait. This vine has a 15-foot reach. Make a melee spell attack roll against the target; on a success, the vine pulls the target into the creepers and makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round or until the creature Escapes (against your spell DC), whichever comes first.
Tangling Creepers.name: Tangling Creepers

Shifting Sand.description:
You cause the surface to heave. The area becomes difficult terrain and any tracks in the area are destroyed by the churning ground. Creatures standing in the area take a -1 status penalty to Acrobatics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balance} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble Through} and Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}. The first time each round you Sustain the Spell, you can move the churning area up to 10 feet in any direction. Creatures immobilized by the spell are carried along with the shifting sand in the same direction, if possible; this movement is forced movement. Creatures that enter or begin their turn standing in the shifting sand must attempt a Reflex save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and ignores the area's difficult terrain and penalty to skill checks until the end of its turn.

Success The creature ignores the area's penalty to skill checks until the end of its turn.

Failure The creature is affected normally by the spell this turn.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} within the spell's area until it Escapes. If the creature was already immobilized by shifting sands, it also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Heightened (5th) The status penalty increases to -2 and the spell's range increases to 60 feet.

Heightened (7th) The status penalty increases to -3, the spell's range increases to 60 feet, and the spell's area increases to a 30-foot burst.

Heightened (9th) The status penalty increases to -4, the spell's range increases to 60 feet, and the spell's area increases to a 40-foot burst.
Shifting Sand.name: Shifting Sand

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical light of your darkness spell's rank or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.

Heightened (4th) Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}.

Entangle (At Will).name: Entangle (At Will)
Entangle (At Will).description: Plants in the area entangle creatures. The area counts as difficult terrain. Each round that a creature starts its turn in the area, it must attempt a Reflex save. On a failure, it takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it leaves the area, and on a critical failure, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round. Creatures can attempt to Escape at entangle's DC to remove these effects.

Invisibility (at will, self only).description:
Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.
Invisibility (at will, self only).name: Invisibility (at will, self only)

Speak with Animals (Constant).name: Speak with Animals (Constant)
Speak with Animals (Constant).description: You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals. The spell doesn't make them more friendly than normal. Cunning animals are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.

Summon Animal.name: Summon Animal
Summon Animal.description:
You conjure an animal to fight for you. You summon a common creature that has the animal trait and whose level is -1, such as those found in Pathfinder Bestiary volumes. Heightening the spell increases the maximum level of creature you can summon.

Heightened (2nd) Level 1

Heightened (3rd) Level 2

Heightened (4th) Level 3

Heightened (5th) Level 5

Heightened (6th) Level 7

Heightened (7th) Level 9

Heightened (8th) Level 11

Heightened (9th) Level 13

Heightened (10th) Level 15

equipment-Shortbow.name: Shortbow
equipment-Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

equipment-Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.
equipment-Arrows.name: Arrows

Reactive Strike (Special).name: 反应打击 Reactive Strike (特殊)
Reactive Strike (Special).description:
如果鹰虎的反应打击造成重击，除了造成伤害外，他还能选择对目标进行一次@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{卸武 Disarm}。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

Soaring Flight.name: 振翅冲天 Soaring Flight
Soaring Flight.description:
频率 每日一次

鹰虎振翅而飞，在5分钟内获得25尺@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{飞行 Fly}。

Blade Barrage.name: 剑幕如雨 Blade Barrage
Blade Barrage.description:
鹰虎进行五次近战打击。它的多重攻击减值正常计算。每次成功的打击都能让后续打击在伤害骰上获得+2环境加值。若一个目标被至少2次该打击命中，该目标额外受到@Damage[2d6[bleed]]伤害。目标直到它的下个回合开始前，会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.aMQxiTCdTxVcradv]{效果：剑幕如雨}

Disarming Whirl.name: 断兵如轮 Disarming Whirl
Disarming Whirl.description: 鹰虎旋转着攻击敌人们的武器。鹰虎进行一次@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{卸武 Disarm}运动检定对抗他近战触及内所有敌人。每次卸武尝试都会增加他的多次攻击减值，但只在所有卸武检定完成后适用。

Attack of Opportunity (Special).name: Attack of Opportunity (Special)
Attack of Opportunity (Special).description:
If Takatorra's Attack of Opportunity is a critical success, they can choose to automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the targeted creature in addition to dealing damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

equipment-Tengu Gale Blade.name: Tengu Gale Blade
equipment-Tengu Gale Blade.description: This fan-shaped sword, designed by members of the tengu ancestry, has five broad blades that join at its hilt. Tengu sailors also use gale blades as makeshift weather vanes, as the sword spins to show the wind's direction when loosely held aloft.

equipment-Composite Longbow.name: Composite Longbow
equipment-Composite Longbow.description: This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow's range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil's favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.

equipment-Hide Armor.name: Hide Armor
equipment-Hide Armor.description: A mix of furs, sturdy hide, and sometimes molded boiled leather, this armor provides protection due to its layers of leather, though its bulkiness slows the wearer down and decreases mobility.

equipment-Arrows.name: Arrows
equipment-Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

Soaring Flight.name: 振翅冲天 Soaring Flight
Soaring Flight.description:
频率 每天一次

身为天狗怎可被脚下地面给束缚。你召出魔法羽翼，或是使既存的翅膀延伸。鹰虎振翅而飞，在5分钟内获得25尺@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{飞行 Fly}速度。

Blade Barrage.name: 剑幕如雨 Blade Barrage
Blade Barrage.description: 鹰虎进行三次近战打击。这些打击获得叠劲特征。若一个目标被至少2次该打击命中，该目标额外受到@Damage[1d6[bleed]]伤害。受该持续流血伤害影响的生物，会一直处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}状态中。

Disarming Whirl.name: 断兵如轮 Disarming Whirl
Disarming Whirl.description: 鹰虎旋转着攻击敌人们的武器。鹰虎进行一次@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{卸武 Disarm}运动检定对抗他近战触及内所有敌人。每次卸武尝试都会增加他的多次攻击减值，但只在所有卸武检定完成后适用。

equipment-Tengu Gale Blade.name: Tengu Gale Blade
equipment-Tengu Gale Blade.description: This fan-shaped sword, designed by members of the tengu ancestry, has five broad blades that join at its hilt. Tengu sailors also use gale blades as makeshift weather vanes, as the sword spins to show the wind's direction when loosely held aloft.

equipment-Hide Armor.name: Hide Armor
equipment-Hide Armor.description: A mix of furs, sturdy hide, and sometimes molded boiled leather, this armor provides protection due to its layers of leather, though its bulkiness slows the wearer down and decreases mobility.

Tamikan.name: 塔米坎 Tamikan
Tamikan.allSaves: 对全魔法豁免+1状态加值
Tamikan.publicNotes:
虽然碎舟龙与翼龙相似，并且来自近似的时代，但它们其实是龙类的一个原始分支。它们脑子不算很好使，也缺乏龙族所拥有的的强大魔法，但碎舟龙拥有一个超自然坚硬的喙，可以凿穿任何难以置信的致密物质。虽然它的喙看起来是非常棒的战利品，但碎舟龙死后喙上的魔法也就消失了，所以用它的喙制造武器的尝试都以失败告终。

虽然它们生活在沼泽和其他相对安静的水域，但碎舟龙更喜欢在河流和小溪环境中捕猎，因为活水总会吸引新的猎物。它们捕猎一切，并且很清楚它们强大的喙能击沉船只和木法。它们具有像龙一样贪婪的外表。虽然碎舟龙对物质财富和社会权力漠不关心，但它们占据大片猎场，会暴力攻击任何潜在的竞争对手，贪婪地屠戮领地内的大型动物，留下只吃了一半的尸体，根本不考虑将来还有没有食物。

当碎舟龙所声称的领土中包含某个社区时，那里的人别无选择，只能想办法捕杀邪恶的捕食者，或雇佣冒险者来完成这个任务。碎舟龙如此饥肠辘辘，一只就能毁灭整群的牲畜，威胁整个社区的安全。和它们的龙类亲戚不同，碎舟龙从不讨价还价，通过祭祀来安抚它们的尝试也不会有任何效果。

Reactive Strike (Tail Only).name: 反应打击 Reactive Strike (仅甩尾)

Boat Breaker.name: 破船者 Boat Breaker
Boat Breaker.description: 碎舟龙的喙异常坚硬。它们的喙啄打击无视任何物品的一半硬度。

Flying Strafe.name: 飞掠 Flying Strafe
Flying Strafe.description: 碎舟龙以最大速度飞行，并且在行动中的任意地点进行两次翼拍打击。每次打击必须针对不同目标。

Sonic Screech.name: 音波尖啸 Sonic Screech
Sonic Screech.description: 塔米坎释放一股致死性的音波尖啸，对@Template[line|distance:100]范围造成@Damage[12d6[sonic]]伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic]豁免）。它在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Sonic Screech]]{1d4轮}内无法再使用音波尖啸。

Wailing Dive.name: 哀鸣俯冲 Wailing Dive
Wailing Dive.description:
碎舟龙飞行，并且发出可怕的尖叫。每个碎舟龙飞过的生物必须通过@Check[will|dc:37]豁免，否则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}（大失败则@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}）。

进行豁免后，生物暂时免疫此能力1小时。在移动结束之后，碎舟龙可以进行一次喙啄打击。

+1 status to all saves vs. magic.name: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Tino Tung (Level 13).name: 千野·董(13级) Tino Tung (Level 13)
Tino Tung (Level 13).allSaves: 对抗疾病的所有豁免有+1状态加值
Tino Tung (Level 13).blurb: 男性天舒族,义洛里的圣武士

+1 status to all saves vs. disease.name: 对抗疾病的所有豁免有+1状态加值

Retributive Strike.name: 报应打击 Retributive Strike
Retributive Strike.description:
触发 一名敌人伤害了你的盟友，并且他们都在你周围15尺的范围内。

你保护你的盟友并痛击你的敌人。这位盟友在对抗触发这次报应打击的伤害时获得针对所有伤害的抗力，数值等同于2+你的等级。如果这名敌人在你的触及范围之内，你对其进行一次近战打击。

如果千野的报应打击命中，目标还受到@Damage[3[persistent,spirit]]。

如果千野的报应打击没有大失败，目标直到它的下个回合结束前，视为满足千野的挑衅推撞能力的发动需求。

Defiant Shove.name: 挑衅推撞 Defiant Shove
Defiant Shove.description:
需求 千野从他的前一个回合开始到现在使用过报应打击，并确实尝试过打击目标，并且没有大失败

效果 千野身体发力向前猛力一推。他将目标向任意方向移动5尺，并且尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{摔绊 Trip}目标。这是一个强制移动效果。

Divine Smite.name: 神圣制裁 Divine Smite
Divine Smite.description: 如果千野的报应打击命中，目标还受到@Damage[3[persistent,spirit]]。

Powerful Fists.name: 强力拳 Powerful Fists
Powerful Fists.description: 千野的拳头打击造成致命伤时不会受到非致命的攻击减值。

Flurry of Blows.name: 疾风连击 Flurry of Blows
Flurry of Blows.description: 千野进行两次无武装打击。若两次命中同一个生物，计算抗力和弱点时将伤害合计。

Ki Blast.name: Ki Blast
Ki Blast.description:
You unleash your ki as a powerful blast of force that deals 2d6 force damage.

If you use 2 actions to cast ki blast, increase the size of the cone to @Template[cone|distance:30]{30 feet} and the damage to @Damage[3d6[force]]{3d6}.

If you use 3 actions to cast ki blast, increase the size of the cone to @Template[cone|distance:60]{60 feet} and the damage to @Damage[4d6[force]]{4d6}.

Each creature in the area must attempt a Fortitude saving throw.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is pushed 5 feet.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is pushed 10 feet.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6, or by [[/r 2d6]] if you use 2 or 3 actions.

Ki Strike.name: Ki Strike
Ki Strike.description:
You focus your ki into magical attacks. Make an unarmed Strike or Flurry of Blows (this doesn't change the limit on using only one flourish per turn).

You gain a +1 status bonus to your attack rolls with the Strikes, and the Strikes deal 1d6 extra damage. This damage can be any of the following types of your choice, chosen each time you Strike: force, lawful (only if you're lawful), negative, or positive.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.8olfnTmWh0GGPDqX]{Spell Effect: Ki Strike}

Heightened (+4) The extra damage increases by 1d6.

Lay on Hands.name: Lay on Hands
Lay on Hands.description:
Your hands become infused with vitality energy, healing a living creature or damaging an undead creature with a touch.

If you use lay on hands on a willing living target, you restore 6 Hit Points; if the target is one of your allies, they also gain a +2 status bonus to AC for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.lyLMiauxIVUM3oF1]{Spell Effect: Lay on Hands}

Against an undead target, you deal 1d6 damage and it must attempt a basic Fortitude save; if it fails, it also takes a -2 status penalty to AC for 1 round.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing increases by 6, and the damage to an undead target increases by 1d6.

equipment-Temple Sword.name: Temple Sword
equipment-Temple Sword.description: This heavy blade is favored by guardians of religious sites. It has a distinctive, crescent-shaped blade that seems to be a mix of a sickle and sword. It often has holes drilled into the blade or the pommel so that bells or other holy trinkets can be affixed to the weapon as an aid for prayer or mediation.

equipment-+2 Greater Striking Handwraps.description:
As you invest these embroidered strips of cloth, you must meditate and slowly wrap them around your hands. These handwraps have weapon runes etched into them to give your unarmed attacks the benefits of those runes, making your unarmed attacks work like magic weapons. For example, +1 striking handwraps of mighty blows would give you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with your unarmed attacks and increase the damage of your unarmed attacks from one weapon die to two (normally 2d4 instead of 1d4, but if your fists have a different weapon damage die or you have other unarmed attacks, use two of that die size instead).

You can upgrade, add, and transfer runes to and from the handwraps just as you would for a weapon, and you can attach talismans to the handwraps. Treat the handwraps as melee weapons of the brawling group with light Bulk for these purposes. Property runes apply only when they would be applicable to the unarmed attack you're using. For example, a property that must be applied to a slashing weapon wouldn't function when you attacked with a fist, but you would gain its benefits if you attacked with a claw or some other slashing unarmed attack.
equipment-+2 Greater Striking Handwraps.name: +2 Greater Striking Handwraps of Mighty Blows

equipment-Explorer's Clothing.name: Explorer's Clothing
equipment-Explorer's Clothing.description: Adventurers who don't wear armor travel in durable clothing. Though it's not armor and uses your unarmored defense proficiency, it still has a Dex Cap and can grant an item bonus to AC if etched with potency runes.

Tino Tung (Level 9).name: 千野·董(9级) Tino Tung (Level 9)
Tino Tung (Level 9).allSaves: 对疾病全豁免+1状态加值
Tino Tung (Level 9).blurb: 男性，天舒人，义洛里的圣武士

+1 status to all saves vs. disease.name: 对疾病全豁免+1状态加值

Powerful Fists.name: 强力拳 Powerful Fists
Powerful Fists.description: 千野的拳头打击造成致命伤时不会受到非致命的攻击减值。

Flurry of Blows.name: 疾风连击 Flurry of Blows
Flurry of Blows.description: 千野进行两次无武装打击。若两次命中同一个生物，计算抗力和弱点时将伤害合计。

Retributive Strike.name: Retributive Strike
Retributive Strike.description:
Trigger An enemy damages Tino's ally, and both are within 15 feet of him

Tino protects his ally and strikes his foe. The ally gains resistance 11 to all damage against the triggering damage. If the foe is within reach, he makes a melee Strike against it.

If Tino hits with his Retributive Strike, the target takes @Damage[3[persistent,spirit]] damage.

Ki Blast.name: Ki Blast
Ki Blast.description:
You unleash your ki as a powerful blast of force that deals 2d6 force damage.

If you use 2 actions to cast ki blast, increase the size of the cone to 30 feet and the damage to @Damage[3d6[force]].

If you use 3 actions to cast ki blast, increase the size of the cone to 60 feet and the damage to @Damage[4d6[force]].

Each creature in the area must attempt a Fortitude saving throw.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is pushed 5 feet.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is pushed 10 feet.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6, or by [[/r 2d6]] if you use 2 or 3 actions.

Lay on Hands.name: Lay on Hands
Lay on Hands.description:
Your hands become infused with vitality energy, healing a living creature or damaging an undead creature with a touch.

If you use lay on hands on a willing living target, you restore 6 Hit Points; if the target is one of your allies, they also gain a +2 status bonus to AC for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.lyLMiauxIVUM3oF1]{Spell Effect: Lay on Hands}

Against an undead target, you deal 1d6 damage and it must attempt a basic Fortitude save; if it fails, it also takes a -2 status penalty to AC for 1 round.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing increases by 6, and the damage to an undead target increases by 1d6.

equipment-+1 Striking Handwraps of Might.description:

These handwraps have weapon runes etched into them to give your unarmed attacks the benefits of those runes, making your unarmed attacks work like magic weapons. For example, +1 striking handwraps of mighty blows would give you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with your unarmed attacks and increase the damage of your unarmed attacks from one weapon die to two (normally 2d4 instead of 1d4, but if your fists have a different weapon damage die or you have other unarmed attacks, use two of that die size instead).

You can upgrade, add, and transfer runes to and from the handwraps just as you would for a weapon, and you can attach talismans to the handwraps. Treat the handwraps as melee weapons of the brawling group with light Bulk for these purposes. Property runes apply only when they would be applicable to the unarmed attack you're using. For example, a property that must be applied to a slashing weapon wouldn't function when you attacked with a fist, but you would gain its benefits if you attacked with a claw or some other slashing unarmed attack.

Ki Strike.description:

You gain a +1 status bonus to your attack rolls with the Strikes, and the Strikes deal 1d6 extra damage. This damage can be any of the following types of your choice, chosen each time you Strike: force, lawful (only if you're lawful), negative, or positive.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.8olfnTmWh0GGPDqX]{Spell Effect: Ki Strike}

Heightened (+4) The extra damage increases by 1d6.

equipment-Explorer's Clothing.name: Explorer's Clothing
equipment-Explorer's Clothing.description: Adventurers who don't wear armor travel in durable clothing. Though it's not armor and uses your unarmored defense proficiency, it still has a Dex Cap and can grant an item bonus to AC if etched with potency runes.

Avalanche Pummel.name: 雪崩拳 Avalanche Pummel
Avalanche Pummel.description: 特罗夫对一个@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}的生物进行一次凿落冰凌打击。如果命中，该生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{目眩 Dazzled}。如果重击，生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{目盲 Blinded}。无论哪种情况，效果持续到特罗夫的下个回合开始。如果打击失手（但是没有大失败），特罗夫依然对目标造成@Damage[13[piercing]]伤害。

Chattering Blow.name: 寒颤猛击 Chattering Blow
Chattering Blow.description:
需求 特罗夫位于一个自从特罗夫上个回合结束后受到过寒冷伤害的生物的触及范围内

效果 特罗夫猛戳被寒冷削弱的生物的穴位。生物必须尝试@Check[fortitude|dc:31|traits:damaging-effect]豁免，否则它的皮肤被冻结，四肢变得迟钝和笨拙。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物受到@Damage[2d4[persistent,cold]]伤害并且速度受到-5尺状态减值，直到持续性寒冷伤害结束。对该生物造成火焰伤害是一种特别有效的帮助（允许生物尝试一次新的DC10纯骰检定来结束持续伤害）。

失败 类似成功，但是伤害为@Damage[4d4[persistent,cold]]并且速度减值为-15尺。

大失败 类似成功，但是伤害为@Damage[6d4[persistent,cold]]并且生物被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{禁足 Immobilized}。

Icicle Stance.name: 冰凌架势 Icicle Stance
Icicle Stance.description:
触发 特罗夫投掷先攻或他的回合开始

效果 特罗夫准备好像冰凌一样突然出击。在此架势下，特罗夫能进行凿落冰凌打击。当特罗夫位于一个生物上方并且在此架势中时，该生物对他@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}。

Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
Flurry of Blows.description: Troff makes two Strikes with his fist or with a monk weapon. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

equipment-+2 Striking Frost Handwraps of.name: +2 Striking Frost Handwraps of Mighty Blows
equipment-+2 Striking Frost Handwraps of.description:
As you invest these embroidered strips of cloth, you must meditate and slowly wrap them around your hands. These handwraps have weapon runes etched into them to give your unarmed attacks the benefits of those runes, making your unarmed attacks work like magic weapons. For example, +1 striking handwraps of mighty blows would give you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with your unarmed attacks and increase the damage of your unarmed attacks from one weapon die to two (normally 2d4 instead of 1d4, but if your fists have a different weapon damage die or you have other unarmed attacks, use two of that die size instead).

You can upgrade, add, and transfer runes to and from the handwraps just as you would for a weapon, and you can attach talismans to the handwraps. Treat the handwraps as melee weapons of the brawling group with light Bulk for these purposes. Property runes apply only when they would be applicable to the unarmed attack you're using. For example, a property that must be applied to a slashing weapon wouldn't function when you attacked with a fist, but you would gain its benefits if you attacked with a claw or some other slashing unarmed attack.

equipment-Bracers of Armor II.name: Bracers of Armor II
equipment-Bracers of Armor II.description: These stiff leather armguards grant you a +2 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

Tyrannosaurus Imperator.name: 帝皇暴龙 Tyrannosaurus Imperator
Tyrannosaurus Imperator.publicNotes:
暴龙被认为是一般意义上的恐龙之王，它是巨大的掠食者，嘴巴宽大，牙齿锋利无比。暴龙被愤怒和饥饿驱使，是大胆无畏的食肉动物，它们会贪婪地大口咬下大型猎物的肉块，或者一口吞下较小的猎物，比如大多数人类。虽然暴龙可以吃腐肉生存，但它们更偏爱活物。

暴龙用两条粗壮有力的后腿站立，这使它们跑得很快，而它们粗壮的尾巴为它们提供了优良的平衡能力。虽然它们退化的前爪除了在用嘴撕扯猎物的时候起到固定作用以外很少被用到，但是前段也有锋利的尖爪。暴龙单独行动时就够可怕了，但是它们有时也会成群捕食，以杀死更大体型的猎物。只有最强大的生物才能成功驯服暴龙，即便如此，它们也需要为这头贪婪的猛兽提供大量肉食来喂养。

一些巨人部落，尤其是独眼巨人，或是位于原始大陆不为人所知的居民，甚至会训练暴龙称为坐骑或战兽。在其他地方，修格斯用囚犯喂养这些强大的恐龙，作为处决或祭祀仪式的一部分。一些修格斯教派甚至崇拜暴龙，将它们视为暴力的恶魔般的半神。在这些情况下，这些被饲养长大的暴龙已经习惯被人投喂，对喂养者和驯兽师的态度表现得较为友好。暴龙身长50尺，体重达到7吨以上。

暴龙的其他变种中，体型要稍微小些的有异龙，体型更大的有南巨龙。即便是体型最小的暴龙，例如矮暴龙，其体型也不会小于大型。然而尽管他们体型要小一圈，但是它们的凶猛程度却不亚于暴龙，那些认为矮暴龙训练起来“更安全”的人应该三思！

Fling.name: 抛掷 Fling
Fling.description:
需求 一个生物被暴龙擒抱在嘴里。

效果 暴龙把嘴里的生物扔到离它嘴10英尺高，20英尺远的空中。目标生物视为坠落25尺（假设暴龙尽可能高地将目标扔到高处），并承受相应的坠落伤害(@Damage[12[bludgeoning]]伤害)。如果该生物落在另一个生物身上，则被砸中的生物将受到相同数量的钝击伤害。被砸中的生物可以通过@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic]豁免来躲避。

Pin Prey.name: 摁死 Pin Prey
Pin Prey.description:
触发 暴龙用脚踩对大型或更小体型的敌人造成重击。

效果 暴龙脚踩打击命中的生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}，并且暴龙用它的脚踩牢牢把敌人摁在当前的方格里。只要暴龙一直不移动，被摁死的生物视同@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed}。暴龙对被摁死的目标的攻击检定有+2环境加值，但是此时暴龙无法对其使用活吞能力，除非暴龙用嘴咬的方式@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{擒获 Grab}目标。

Tail Swipe.name: 甩尾 Tail Swipe
Tail Swipe.description:
暴龙甩尾横扫@Template[cone|distance:15]{15尺锥形}范围，对范围内所有生物造成@Damage[(4d8+12)[bludgeoning]]伤害。范围内生物必须进行@Check[reflex|dc:34|traits:damaging-effect]豁免。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物受到一半伤害。

失败 生物受到全额伤害并且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}。

大失败 生物受到双倍伤害，被击退10 尺，然后倒地。

Umbasi.name: 乌木巴西 Umbasi
Umbasi.blurb: 泛性别精灵传智学派旁听生

Story of Valor.name: 勇气传说 Story of Valor
Story of Valor.description: 乌木巴西阐述了勇气和尊重的价值观。它能减少30尺内所有盟友的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened}状态值1点并且移除@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{逃跑 Fleeing}状态。如果它在战斗中第一次使用该动作，乌木巴西便能自动让观众为自己的队伍欢呼一次。

Inspire Heroics.name: Inspire Heroics
Inspire Heroics.description:
You call upon your muse to greatly increase the benefits you provide with your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IAjvwqgiDr3qGYxY]{Courageous Anthem} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.bH0kPuf7UKxRvi2P]{Rallying Anthem} composition. If your next action is to cast inspire courage or inspire defense, attempt a Performance check. The DC is usually a very hard DC of a level equal to that of the highest-level target of your composition, but the GM can assign a different DC based on the circumstances. The effect of your inspire courage or inspire defense composition depends on the result of your check.

Critical Success The status bonus from your inspire courage or inspire defense increases to +3.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.VFereWC1agrwgzPL]{Critical Success on Inspire Courage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.BKam63zT98iWMJH7]{Critical Success on Inspire Defense}

Success The status bonus from inspire courage or inspire defense increases to +2.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.kZ39XWJA3RBDTnqG]{Success on Inspire Courage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Chol7ExtoN2T36mP]{Success on Inspire Defense}

Failure Your inspire courage or inspire defense provides only its normal bonus of +1, but you don't spend the Focus Point for casting this spell.

True Strike.name: True Strike
True Strike.description:
A glimpse into the future ensures your next blow strikes true. The next time you make an attack roll before the end of your turn, roll the attack twice and use the better result. The attack ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the target being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.fpGDAz2v5PG0zUSl]{Spell Effect: Sure Strike}

equipment-Composite Longbow.name: Composite Longbow
equipment-Composite Longbow.description: This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow's range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil's favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.

equipment-Arrows.name: Arrows
equipment-Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

Mask of Terror.name: Mask of Terror
Mask of Terror.description:
The target appears to be a gruesome and terrifying creature. The effect is unique to each observer, so a human viewing the target might see a demon with bloody fangs, but a demon observing the target might see a glowing angelic visage. When any creature attempts a hostile action against the target, the creature must attempt a Will save. It is then temporarily immune until the end of its next turn.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} before using its action.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}, and its action fails and is wasted.

Heightened (8th) You can target up to 5 creatures. If a creature uses a hostile action or reaction that affects multiple targets simultaneously, it needs to attempt only one save against mask of terror.

True Target.name: True Target
True Target.description: You delve into the possible futures of the next few seconds to understand all the ways your foe might avoid harm, then cast out a vision of that future to those around you. Designate a creature. The first time each target makes an attack roll against that creature during true target's duration, the attacker rolls twice and uses the better result. The attacker also ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the designated creature being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

Collective Transposition.name: Collective Transposition
Collective Transposition.description:
You teleport the targets to new positions within the area. The creatures must each be able to fit in their new space, and their positions must be unoccupied, entirely within the area, and in your line of sight. Unwilling creatures can attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target can teleport if it wants, but it chooses the destination within range.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure You teleport the target and choose its destination.

Heightened (+1) The number of targets increases by 1.

True Seeing.name: True Seeing
True Seeing.description: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).

Zealous Conviction.name: Zealous Conviction
Zealous Conviction.description:
You bypass your targets' rational minds, instilling them with unshakable conviction and zeal. The targets each gain 12 temporary Hit Points and a +2 status bonus to Will saves against mental effects, as their faith overrides the signals from their own bodies and minds. If you tell a target to do something, it must comply with your request, though if it would normally find the task repugnant, it can attempt a Will save at the end of its turn each round due to the cognitive dissonance. On a success, it ends the spell's effects on itself entirely.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.nemThuhp3praALY6]{Spell Effect: Zealous Conviction}

Illusory Scene.name: Illusory Scene
Illusory Scene.description:
You form an imaginary scene that includes up to 10 discrete creatures or objects of various sizes, all of which must be within the spell's area. These elements generate appropriate sounds and smells, and they feel right to the touch. Elements of an illusory scene are incapable of speech. Unlike with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8SBoXiXQjlCKqly]{Illusory Creature} spell, creatures in your scene lack combat abilities and statistics. Your scene doesn't include changes to the environment around it, though you can place your scene within the illusory environment of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage} spell.

When you create the scene, you can choose to have it be static or follow a program. Though a static scene is stationary, it includes basic natural movement. For example, wind blowing on an illusory piece of paper would rustle it. A program can be up to 1 minute long and repeats when finished. For instance, you could create a scene of two orcs fighting each other, and the fight would go the same way for each repetition. If you create a loop, the two fighters end up in the same place at the start of the scene and at the end of it, but you can smooth the program so it's hard to tell when the loop ends and begins. Anyone observing the scene for more than a few minutes almost always notices it looping. You're unable to alter the program after you create the illusion.

Any creature that touches any part of the image or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve your illusion. If they interact with a portion of the illusion, they disbelieve only that portion. They disbelieve the entire scene only on a critical success.

Heightened (6th) Creatures or objects in your scene can speak. You must speak the specific lines for each actor when creating your program. The spell disguises your voice for each actor.

Heightened (8th) As the 6th-rank version, and the duration is unlimited.

Shadow Blast.name: Shadow Blast
Shadow Blast.description:
You shape the quasi-real substance of the Shadow Plane into a blast. Choose acid, bludgeoning, cold, electricity, fire, force, piercing, slashing, or sonic damage, and choose a 30-foot cone, a 15-foot burst within 120 feet, or a 50-foot line. The blast deals 5d8 damage of the type you chose to each creature in the area.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Shadow Siphon.name: Shadow Siphon
Shadow Siphon.description:
Trigger A spell or magical effect deals damage.

Exchanging material energy with that of the Shadow Plane, you transform the triggering spell into a partially illusory version of itself. Attempt to counteract the target spell. If the attempt is successful, any creatures that would be damaged by the spell instead take only half as much damage, but the spell otherwise works as normal. Treat shadow siphon's counteract rank as 2 higher for this attempt.

Blink.name: Blink
Blink.description:
You blink quickly between the Material Plane and the Ethereal Plane. You gain resistance 5 to all damage (except force). You can Sustain the Spell to vanish and reappear 10 feet away in a random direction determined by the GM; the movement doesn't trigger reactions. At the end of your turn, you vanish and reappear as above.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.ZlsuhS9J0S3PuvCO]{Spell Effect: Blink}

Heightened (+2) The resistance increases by 3.

Dimension Door.name: Dimension Door
Dimension Door.description:
Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
The target can soar through the air, gaining a fly Speed equal to its Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

Heightened (7th) The duration increases to 1 hour.

Enthrall.name: Enthrall
Enthrall.description:
Your words fascinate your targets. You speak or sing without interruption throughout the casting and duration. Targets who notice your speech or song might give their undivided attention; each target must attempt a Will save. The GM might grant a circumstance bonus (to a maximum of +4) if the target is of an opposing religion, ancestry, or political leaning, or is otherwise unlikely to agree with what you're saying.

Each creature that comes within range has to attempt a save when you Sustain the Spell. If you're speaking, enthrall gains the linguistic trait.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and notices that you tried to use magic.

Success The target needn't pay attention but doesn't notice you tried to use magic (it might notice others are enthralled).

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with you. It can attempt another Will save if it witnesses actions or speech with which it disagrees. If it succeeds, it's no longer Fascinated and is temporarily immune for 1 hour. If the target is subject to a hostile act, or if another creature succeeds at a Diplomacy or Intimidation check against it, the fascination ends immediately.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target can't attempt a save to end the fascination if it disagrees with you.

Heroism.name: Heroism
Heroism.description:
You tap into the target's inner heroism, granting it a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks.

Heightened (6th) The status bonus increases to +2.

Heightened (9th) The status bonus increases to +3.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.l9HRQggofFGIxEse]{Spell Effect: Heroism}

Invisibility Sphere.name: Invisibility Sphere
Invisibility Sphere.description:
You and all targets are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} except to each other as long as you remain within the spell's area. If a creature made invisible by this spell leaves the spell's area, it becomes visible and remains so even if it returns to the spell's area. If any creature made invisible by this spell uses a hostile action, the spell ends after the hostile action is completed.

While exploring, it's easy to move together slowly and remain invisible. This is untenable in a battle, however. Once an encounter begins, creatures remain invisible until at most the end of the first round, at which point the spell ends.

Heightened (5th) The duration increases to 1 hour.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description: You unravel the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. If you successfully counteract a magic item, the item becomes a mundane item of its type for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, you automatically fail.

Inspire Defense.name: Inspire Defense
Inspire Defense.description:
You inspire yourself and your allies to protect themselves more effectively. You and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to AC and saving throws, as well as resistance equal to half the spell's rank to physical damage.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.DLwTvjjnqs2sNGuG]{Spell Effect: Rallying Anthem}

Silence.name: Silence
Silence.description:
The target makes no sound, preventing creatures from noticing it using hearing or other senses alone. The target can't use sonic attacks, nor can it use actions with the auditory trait. This prevents it from casting spells that include verbal components.

Heightened (4th) The spell effect emanates from the touched creature, silencing all sound in or passing through a 10- foot radius and preventing any auditory and sonic effects in the affected area. While within the radius, creatures are subject to the same effects as the target. Depending upon the position of the effect, a creature might notice the lack of sound reaching it (blocking off the noise coming from a party, for example).

Sound Burst.name: Sound Burst
Sound Burst.description:
A cacophonous noise blasts out, dealing 2d10 sonic damage. Each creature must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is Deafened for 1 minute, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d10.

Counter Performance.name: Counter Performance
Counter Performance.description:
Trigger You or an ally within 60 feet rolls a saving throw against an auditory or visual effect.

Your performance protects you and your allies. Roll a Performance check for a type you know: an auditory performance if the trigger was auditory, or a visual one for a visual trigger. You and allies in the area can use the better result between your Performance check and the saving throw.

Daze.name: Daze
Daze.description:
You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

Guidance.name: Guidance
Guidance.description:
You ask for divine guidance, granting the target a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check the target attempts before the duration ends. The target chooses which roll to use the bonus on before rolling. If the target uses the bonus, the spell ends. Either way, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3qHKBDF7lrHw8jFK]{Spell Effect: Guidance}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3LyOkV25p7wA181H]{Effect: Guidance Immunity}

Inspire Courage.name: Inspire Courage
Inspire Courage.description:
You inspire yourself and your allies with words or tunes of encouragement. You and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.beReeFroAx24hj83]{Spell Effect: Courageous Anthem}

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
The object glows, casting bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) like a torch. If you cast this spell again on a second object, the light spell on the first object ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.cVVZXNbV0nElVOPZ]{Spell Effect: Light}

Heightened (4th) The object sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).

Message.name: Message
Message.description:
You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you.

The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.

Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description:
You ward a creature with protective energy that deters enemy attacks. Creatures attempting to attack the target must attempt a Will save each time. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends.

Critical Success Sanctuary ends.

Success The creature can attempt its attack and any other attacks against the target this turn.

Failure The creature can't attack the target and wastes the action. It can't attempt further attacks against the target this turn.

Critical Failure The creature wastes the action and can't attempt to attack the target for the rest of sanctuary's duration.

Spirit Link.name: Spirit Link
Spirit Link.description:
You form a spiritual link with another creature, taking in its pain. When you Cast this Spell and at the start of each of your turns, if the target is below maximum Hit Points, it regains 2 Hit Points (or the difference between its current and maximum Hit Points, if that's lower). You lose as many Hit Points as the target regained.

This is a spiritual transfer, so no effects apply that would increase the Hit Points the target regains or decrease the Hit Points you lose. This transfer also ignores any temporary Hit Points you or the target have. Since this effect doesn't involve vitality or void energy, spirit link works even if you or the target is undead. While the duration persists, you gain no benefit from regeneration or fast healing. You can Dismiss this spell, and if you're ever at 0 Hit Points, spirit link ends automatically.

Heightened (+1) The number of Hit Points transferred each time increases by 2.

equipment-Explorer's Clothing.name: Explorer's Clothing
equipment-Explorer's Clothing.description: Adventurers who don't wear armor travel in durable clothing. Though it's not armor and uses your unarmored defense proficiency, it still has a Dex Cap and can grant an item bonus to AC if etched with potency runes.

Urnak Lostwind.name: 乌尔纳克·遗风 Urnak Lostwind

Reactive Strike (Special).name: 反应打击 Reactive Strike (特殊)
Reactive Strike (Special).description:
乌尔纳克每回合获得1个额外反应动作，但只能用于反应打击。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

Brutally Disarm.name: 蛮力卸武 Brutally Disarm
Brutally Disarm.description:
需求 乌尔纳克双手持握一把双手武器

效果 乌尔纳克尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{卸武 Disarm}触及范围内的一个生物。如果成功或大成功，乌尔纳克对被卸武的生物造成[[/r 13]]点武器伤害类型的伤害。如果卸武失败，他能得到成功的结果。

Felling Throw.name: 砍倒投掷 Felling Throw
Felling Throw.description: 乌尔纳克用巨斧进行一次远程打击。此次打击攻击调整值为+25，巨斧的射程增量为40尺。如果他伤害了一个飞行生物，它下降120尺，并且有可能坠落在地面上。

Ricochet Throw.name: 回弹投掷 Ricochet Throw
Ricochet Throw.description: 当乌尔纳克使用砍倒投掷能力，他的巨斧能在动作结束后飞回来，并且他能以一个自由动作接住它。如果他在回合结束前再次使用砍倒投掷能力（即便改变目标也可以），则该次攻击无视所有掩蔽效果。

Sweep Aside.name: 扫到一边 Sweep Aside
Sweep Aside.description: 乌尔纳克进行一次巨斧近战打击。如果他命中一个体型不超过他的生物，他能将目标向任意方向移动5尺，重击则为10尺。

Attack of Opportunity (Special).name: Attack of Opportunity (Special)
Attack of Opportunity (Special).description:
Urnak gets 1 extra reaction each turn that he can use only to make an Attack of Opportunity.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

equipment-Greataxe.name: Greataxe
equipment-Greataxe.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded", having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

equipment-Hide Armor.name: Hide Armor
equipment-Hide Armor.description: A mix of furs, sturdy hide, and sometimes molded boiled leather, this armor provides protection due to its layers of leather, though its bulkiness slows the wearer down and decreases mobility.

Watchtower Poltergeist.name: 哨塔骚灵 Watchtower Poltergeist
